Degrease tank before passivation or nitric acid will burn the grease into the SS surface. </span><span style=\"color: black; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div><u1:p></u1:p><br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 13.5pt; margin: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div style=\"line-height: 13.5pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: #333333; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\">The pickling is done by: Applying pickling paste. These pastes are based on Nitric acid or Nitric / Hydrofluoric acid mixtures and are applied to the areas of the tank where surface contaminatation is evident. E.g. Coloured oxide films near welds. To wash down the tank surfaces with a mixture of Nitric acid (6 to 15 % by volume) and Hydrofluoric acid 1/2 - 1 1/2% by volume) or somewhat stronger solution of nitric acid (10 - 20% by volume). Although Nitric/ Hydrofluoric acid is faster than Nitric acid care must be taken to ensure that it does not over etch the steel surface. </span><span style=\"color: black; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div><u1:p></u1:p><br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 13.5pt; margin: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div style=\"line-height: 13.5pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: #333333; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\">Another typical pickling paste combination is Nitric acid 14%, Hydroflouric acid 4.8% ,Ammonium BiFlouride 5%, tackiness increment agent 20% and other non ionic surface active stuff. Remember Pickling and Passivation are as different as sugar and salt. Do not confuse one with the other. Picklings strips \u2013passivation armours. Pickling removed hard oxides formed by weld heat. It can be compared to the Johnsons liquid strippper and polish you apply in ships alleyways. Pickling involves metal removal and dulls the visual brightness of SS. Sulphuric acid , phosphoric and hydrochloric acid can be used for pickling\u2014which is removal of impurities.</span><span style=\"color: black; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div><u1:p></u1:p><br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 13.5pt; margin: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div style=\"line-height: 13.5pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: #333333; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\"> Following is the procedure generally used for final cleaning of tanks: Remove weld slag by wire brushing / grinding. The uneven weld profile is ground smooth contour. Remove weld discolouration with abrasive stainless steel wire wool, pickling paste or local swabbing with a pickling solution. Wash the tank with a strong detergent solution to remove grease, swarf, dust, paints, oil etc. The application of heat to the tank will expedite this process. Clean tank surface with a 6 - 15 % nitric acid solution with or without hydrofluoric acid and continue cleaning until all visible scale is removed. Remove as much acid from the tank as possible; wash down throughly with hot water containing a detergent and empty. If the above procedures are correctly carried out a clean iron free surface should be obtained on the tank. You can reuse pickling solutions. If the pickling liquids iron content is &gt;5000 ppm renew the soln.</span><span style=\"color: black; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div><u1:p></u1:p><br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 13.5pt; margin: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div style=\"line-height: 13.5pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: #333333; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\">Over pickling must be avoided. Uniform removal of scale with acid pickling depends on the acid used, acid concentration, solution temperature and contact time. Continuous exposure to pickling solutions for more than 30 mins is not recommended. The item should be drained and rinsed after 30 mins and examined to check the effectiveness of the treatment. Acid cleaning is not generally effective for removal of oils, greases and waxes. The surface should be cleaned to remove oils and greases before acid cleaning. After Sulphuric acid discharge brown discolouration is removed by pickling gel and then again repassivating.</span><span style=\"color: black; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div><u1:p></u1:p><br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 13.5pt; margin: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div style=\"line-height: 13.5pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: #333333; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\">If any repairs or welding have to be carried out on the tank after it has gone in to service than the cleaning and passivation procedure should be repeated, although this need only be over a local area.</span><span style=\"color: black; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div><u1:p></u1:p><br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 13.5pt; margin: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div style=\"line-height: 13.5pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: #333333; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\">Note: although the corrosion resistance of stainless steel improves somewhat as the degree of surface of finish improves, it is unlikely that any practical finishing process, for example hand grinding and disc polishing will result in a significant improvement over the performance of a hot rolled annealed and pickled surface which has been properly cleaned after fabrication. The use of extensive grinding can result in significant loss of thickness, which may be of particular significance in clad steel tanks. The value of grinding and polishing apart from smoothing weld profiles and removing obvious surface defects, is doubtful.</span><span style=\"color: black; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div><u1:p></u1:p><br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 13.5pt; margin: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div style=\"line-height: 13.5pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: #333333; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\">The fresh water is the preferred cleaning medium for stainless steel and where possible it should be always be used. Due to unlimited availability of seawater, it is often used for initial tank cleaning operations. Where this done a final tank wash with fresh water must be given to avoid prolonged contact of pools of stagnant seawater with stainless steel surfaces.</span><span style=\"color: black; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div><u1:p></u1:p><br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 13.5pt; margin: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div style=\"line-height: 13.5pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: #333333; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\">Piping systems require particular attention to avoid leaving inadequately drained areas full of seawater it is not necessary to repeat the acid cleaning and passivation process unless the tank has been repaired or it has carried a particularly corrosive cargo like phosphoric acid containing high levels of chloride and fluoride impurities. The acid could leave steel surface in an active condition with pits containing corrosion products. In such circumstances Nitiric acid treatment after washing would be beneficial.</span><span style=\"color: black; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div><u1:p></u1:p><br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 13.5pt; margin: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div style=\"line-height: 13.5pt; margin: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div style=\"line-height: 13.5pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: #333333; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\">For all practical purposes the general corrosion of austentic stainless steels in sea water can be taken as zero. However the passive film on these steels is prone to local breakdown when chloride ions are present. Hence pitting is likely to occur if stainless steels are left in prolonged contact with static sea water. The attack is likely to occur particularly at crevices or under deposits where access of oxygen to the surface is restricted. Chlorides can locally attack the passive layer and prevent formation of new film. Stagnant salt water can initiate pitting within 24 hrs\u2014you add some Sulphuric acid to it\u2014and time is now reduced to 12 hours.</span><span style=\"color: black; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div><u1:p></u1:p><br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 13.5pt; margin: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div style=\"line-height: 13.5pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: #333333; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\">The addition of Molybednum to stainless steels improves their resistance to pitting and crevice corrosion.</span><span style=\"color: black; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div><u1:p></u1:p><br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 13.5pt; margin: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div style=\"line-height: 13.5pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: #333333; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\">The possibility of pitting of stainless steel is increased if the pH of the seawater is reduced from normal level of about 8. This can happen on chemical tankers which have carried acid cargoes and cleaning of such tanks. Once tank cleaning is commenced must continue without disruption to minimise contact between stainless steel and acidic sea water. The quantity of seawater used must be the maximum possible so as to minimise the drop in ph.</span><span style=\"color: black; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div><u1:p></u1:p><br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 13.5pt; margin: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div style=\"line-height: 13.5pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: #333333; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\">Once sea water cleaning is started than under no circumstances the washing should stop till the tank is cleaned. The final rinsing after seawater should be carried out with fresh water. There should be no possibility of leaving sea water for long periods static in contact with stainless steel. The sea water temperature should not be kept higher than 50C. It is important that there are no stagnant salt water pockets in pipelines. There can be no pitting if salt water flow is greater than 1.2 mtrs/ sec.</span><span style=\"color: black; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div><u1:p></u1:p><br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 13.5pt; margin: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div style=\"line-height: 13.5pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: #333333; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\">Always clean SS tanks asap after discharge even if the same chemical has to be loaded again and again.</span><span style=\"color: black; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div><u1:p></u1:p><br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 13.5pt; margin: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div style=\"line-height: 13.5pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: #333333; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\">In order to obtain the optimum corrosion resistance from stainless steel cargo tanks it is necessary to avoid damage to the tank surfaces. This can be achieved by care in design and fabrication and by treating the steel surface after fabrication in such a way to remove surface contamination.</span><span style=\"color: black; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div><u1:p></u1:p><br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 13.5pt; margin: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div style=\"line-height: 13.5pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: #333333; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\">Care in service should aim at retaining the passive layer on the steel surface which will than provide corrosion resistance throughout the life of the ship. Great care and right procedure should be used for tank cleaning especially after discharging corrosive cargoes like phosphoric acid and using sea water as initial cleaning medium.</span><span style=\"color: black; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div><u1:p></u1:p><br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 13.5pt; margin: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div style=\"line-height: 13.5pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: #333333; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\">Chemicals which attack stainless :</span><span style=\"color: black; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div><u1:p></u1:p><br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 13.5pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: #333333; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\">There is a full lloyds list available with this manual. Some corrode with impurities over the acceptable limit , some corrode due to temperatures over the acceptable limit. A few examples just for understanding are\u2014</span><span style=\"color: black; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div><u1:p></u1:p><br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 13.5pt; margin: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div style=\"line-height: 13.5pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: #333333; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\">Benzene sulphonyl chloride</span><span style=\"color: black; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div><u1:p></u1:p><br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 13.5pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: #333333; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\">Calcium hypochlorite</span><span style=\"color: black; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div><u1:p></u1:p><br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 13.5pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: #333333; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\">Chlorinated paraffins</span><span style=\"color: black; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div><u1:p></u1:p><br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 13.5pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: #333333; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\">Chlorobenzene ( benzyl chloride )</span><span style=\"color: black; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div><u1:p></u1:p><br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 13.5pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: #333333; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\">Dichloro benzene</span><span style=\"color: black; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div><u1:p></u1:p><br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 13.5pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: #333333; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\">Chlorohydrin</span><span style=\"color: black; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div><u1:p></u1:p><br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 13.5pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: #333333; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\">Chlorotoluene</span><span style=\"color: black; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div><u1:p></u1:p><br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 13.5pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: #333333; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\">Dischloroethane</span><span style=\"color: black; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div><u1:p></u1:p><br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 13.5pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: #333333; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\">Dichlorohexane</span><span style=\"color: black; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div><u1:p></u1:p><br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 13.5pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: #333333; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\">Dichloropropane</span><span style=\"color: black; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div><u1:p></u1:p><br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 13.5pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: #333333; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\">Epichlorohydrin</span><span style=\"color: black; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div><u1:p></u1:p><br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 13.5pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: #333333; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\">Drilling brines like calcium bromide and cal chloride soln</span><span style=\"color: black; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div><u1:p></u1:p><br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 13.5pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: #333333; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\">EDC</span><span style=\"color: black; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div><u1:p></u1:p><br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 13.5pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: #333333; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\">Formic acid</span><span style=\"color: black; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div><u1:p></u1:p><br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 13.5pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: #333333; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\">Lignin sulphonic acid</span><span style=\"color: black; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div><u1:p></u1:p><br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 13.5pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: #333333; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\">Magnesium chloride</span><span style=\"color: black; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div><u1:p></u1:p><br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 13.5pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: #333333; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\">Sodium salt solution ( sodium hydrate )</span><span style=\"color: black; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div><u1:p></u1:p><br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 13.5pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: #333333; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\">Perchloroethylene</span><span style=\"color: black; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div><u1:p></u1:p><br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 13.5pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: #333333; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\">Potassium chloride (&gt;10%)</span><span style=\"color: black; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div><u1:p></u1:p><br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 13.5pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: #333333; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\">Potassium hydroxide</span><span style=\"color: black; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div><u1:p></u1:p><br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 13.5pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: #333333; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\">Propionic acid</span><span style=\"color: black; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div><u1:p></u1:p><br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 13.5pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: #333333; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\">Sodium chlorate</span><span style=\"color: black; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div><u1:p></u1:p><br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 13.5pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: #333333; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\">Sodium nitrite sodium sulphate</span><span style=\"color: black; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div><u1:p></u1:p><br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 13.5pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: #333333; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\">Tetrachloro ethane</span><span style=\"color: black; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div><u1:p></u1:p><br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 13.5pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: #333333; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\">Trichloroethane trichloroethylene</span><span style=\"color: black; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div><u1:p></u1:p><br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 13.5pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: #333333; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\">Urea</span><span style=\"color: black; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div><u1:p></u1:p><br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 13.5pt; margin: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div style=\"line-height: 13.5pt; margin: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div style=\"line-height: 13.5pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: #333333; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\">Do not accept odd commercial name cargoes unless you know the product. Many times such things are done to beat the system for lesser customs duties, flouting Marpol laws etc. Read cargo specs carefully. Add up the percentages to form 100% . If does not add up find out what is missing. Of if some important component corrosion accelerators like chloride or flourides are missing from green/ black phosphoric specs find out why they are deliberately omitted.</span><span style=\"color: black; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div><u1:p></u1:p><br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 13.5pt; margin: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div style=\"line-height: 13.5pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: #333333; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\">Or if the moisture content of Epichlorohydrin is not mentioned find out why. For once the stainless steel has pitted you are responsible for destroying a good tank. Once pitting starts you cannot carry sensitive cargoes like potable Ethanol or HMD. Follow proper sampling procedures. Keep samples safely. If tank gets severely pitted get it analysed in an independent lab in order to challenge the false quality certificate. If the tank inspector challenges the condition of the SS cargo tank, counter challenge him by cleaning off part of the bulkhead where ever he wants with the product to be loaded to prove all is OK.</span><span style=\"color: black; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div><u1:p></u1:p><br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 13.5pt; margin: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div style=\"line-height: 13.5pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: #333333; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\">If Hypochlorite solutions are used for tank cleaning they must never be left in the slop tanks. Bleach or Sodium Hypochlorite (11 -13%) is very aggressive to SS especially at elevated temperatures.they must never be allowed to dry up on bulkheads.</span><span style=\"color: black; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div><u1:p></u1:p><br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 13.5pt; margin: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div style=\"line-height: 13.5pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: #333333; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\">Kosher Acetic acid is usually loaded only in stainless steel tanks, though it pits and causes inter granular corrosion.</span><span style=\"color: black; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div><u1:p></u1:p><br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 13.5pt; margin: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div style=\"line-height: 13.5pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: #333333; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\">Sludge sediment from Phosphoric acid made by the wet process ( Silica Quartz) accelerates corrosion. This is the reason why recirc is done.</span><span style=\"color: black; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div><u1:p></u1:p><br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 13.5pt; margin: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div style=\"line-height: 13.5pt; margin: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div style=\"line-height: 13.5pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: #333333; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\">You are not allowed to ballast stainless steel cargo tanks without taking permission from the EMS chemical operator. If it is necessary to ballast stainless steel tanks\u2014</span><span style=\"color: black; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div><u1:p></u1:p><br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 13.5pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: #333333; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\">1) Use clean water up to 98% .</span><span style=\"color: black; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div><u1:p></u1:p><br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 13.5pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: #333333; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\">2) Raise pH value of ballast from 8 to 11 using Caustic Potash.. Say put 40 kg KOH flakes in 1000 tons sea water.</span><span style=\"color: black; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div><u1:p></u1:p><br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 13.5pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: #333333; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\">3) Recirc</span><span style=\"color: black; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div><u1:p></u1:p><br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 13.5pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: #333333; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\">4) Short duration only.</span><span style=\"color: black; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div><u1:p></u1:p><br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 13.5pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: #333333; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\">As soon as the ballast is out rinse with fresh water.</span><span style=\"color: black; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div><u1:p></u1:p><br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 13.5pt; margin: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div style=\"line-height: 13.5pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: #333333; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\">After aggressive cargoes like Sulphuric acid preferably the initial quenching should be done with fresh water. Sulphuric acid leaves liquid top surface profile ( wedge ) of exhothermic corrosion. If it cannot be done immediately use nitrogen blanket. After dischg black/ green phosphoric prewash should preferably be with fresh water. If sufficient fresh water is not available at least the first and last wash can be with FW, with the salt not being allowed to dry up. Acidic stagnant sea water is very dangerous for SS. Weld spatter areas are corrosion initiation points. Weld spatter must always be removed by grinding and pickling. Remove weld discolouration by wire brushing and pickling with brushes.</span><span style=\"color: black; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div><u1:p></u1:p><br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 13.5pt; margin: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div style=\"line-height: 13.5pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: #333333; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\">Shipboard repairs:</span><span style=\"color: black; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div><u1:p></u1:p><br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 13.5pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: #333333; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\">Remember improper welding of ss by pretenders results in complete loss of the corrosion resistant properties. Do not burn ss while grinding. Use self sharpening grinding disc to avoid smearing. Ground area should be white and not blue/ brown. To prevent overheating the grinding disc must be constantly moved over a relatively large area ( use cooling air hose ) . The edges must blend in smooth without sharp edges and borders. If a rag is drawn and lint is shed the surface is too rough. When grinding remember the weld is harder than the ss plate. Always use matching electrode for molybdenum , chromium etc. Use small dia electrode, low heat input and matching amperage. To dry pits use very slight preheat. Minor pittings are ground. Use ss iron free zircon grinding disc of grain 80 ( coarse ) or 120 ( fine ). Zircon has a hardness of more than 8 on the Moh\u2019s scale.</span><span style=\"color: black; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div><u1:p></u1:p><br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 13.5pt; margin: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div style=\"line-height: 13.5pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: #333333; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\">Major pittings are drilled out like a valley ( the is to reach the bottom of the bulb ) and spot welded and then ground smooth. Never drill out pits as a blow hole on a spot weld is a corrosion initiator which will ooze black tatoo liquid once the non inert gas backed weld gets oxidised. Pittings start at 1 mm depth and dia. At times they are hidden with tiny entrance holes to a big cavity. Dye penetrant tests are useful when you know where to look for pittings. If you do not know where to look for pittings you will never find them. Small pittings are covered by a metal flap , but the subsurface bulb cavity may be quite large . The clad steel is only 2mm to 3mm thick on chemical tankers. If the clad steel pitting has breached through , first fill up with arc and then only with tig build up.</span><span style=\"color: black; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div><u1:p></u1:p><br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 13.5pt; margin: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div style=\"line-height: 13.5pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: #333333; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\">Any grinding must be followed by pickling and passivation. Cleaning before pickling must be done with strong warm non caustic alkaline detergent. Pickling burns iron particles and millscale. Every 12 deg rise in temperature halves the pickling time. All repair jobs such as welding, grinding etc., shall be pickled. Never pickle more than 30 minutes. Over-etching of stainless steel may produces coarse surfaces. Pickling contamination which would interfere with the passive oxide film of stainless steel. Pickling reduces pitting corrosion.</span><span style=\"color: black; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div><u1:p></u1:p><br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 13.5pt; margin: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div style=\"line-height: 13.5pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: #333333; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\">In welding SS with oxyacetylene it is necessary to use a tip which is 2 sizes smaller than a normal one used for mild steel. Since heat has a tendency to remain longer in the weld zone of SS a smaller flame reduces the possibility of destroying the properties of SS. A neutral flame is very essential for welding SS. Even a slightly oxidising flame oxidises the chrome in the SS thereby reducing its corrosion resistant qualities. Since it is difficult to maintain an exact neutral flame it is better to use a slight excess of acetylene.</span><span style=\"color: black; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div><u1:p></u1:p><br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 13.5pt; margin: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div style=\"line-height: 13.5pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: #333333; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\">Specially treated columbium filler rods are essential for good welding of SS. If SS rods are not available the second best way would be to cut strips from the mother metal and use them as filler rods. Not only does the chromium in the SS oxidise easily , but the oxide formed during welding acts as an insulating barrier between the flame and the workpiece. Success in welding ss therefore depends hugely on keeping heat to a minimum. Always use SS compatible flux and last but not the least complete the weld in one pass. You do not weave the low current small dia rod weld in SS tanks. Strike the arc on an arc striking plate and then lead the arc to the weld area. This is to make the welding current constant. Weld from edge to pit to other edge to avoid gas inside the pinhole bulb.</span><span style=\"color: black; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div><u1:p></u1:p><br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 13.5pt; margin: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div style=\"line-height: 13.5pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: #333333; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\">Welding rods for say 316L must have a carbon content of &lt;0.03 and a Mo content of&gt; 2.4. If the welding cable is too long, the voltage drop will be too great. If the cable is too small for the current it overheats and the power is lost.</span><span style=\"color: black; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div><u1:p></u1:p><br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 13.5pt; margin: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div style=\"line-height: 13.5pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: #333333; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\">It is commonplace for ageing parcel stainless steel chemical tankers to have on board a TIG welding set a MIG set and a plasma arc cutter. Of course every stainless steel shipyard will have them.</span><span style=\"color: black; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div><u1:p></u1:p><br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 13.5pt; margin: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div style=\"line-height: 13.5pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: #333333; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\">Tig stands for tungsten inert gas. The TIG electrode is non consumable. Inert gas prevents oxidation of electrode. For joints where additional weld metal is needed a filler rod is used.</span><span style=\"color: black; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div><u1:p></u1:p><br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 13.5pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: #333333; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\">It is important to have a weld that has the same properties as the base metal. Such a weld can only be made if the molten puddle is completely protected from the atmosphere, to prevent oxygen and nitrogen from being absorbed into the molten pool ( makes weld weak and porous ). No flux is required. Bonuses being very little smoke , fumes , sparks and weld spatter. If the amperage is &gt; 200 the ceramic cup at torch head is water cooled\u2014otherwise it is air cooled. Argon inert gas is heavier than air and blankets weld well. DC weld has pointed electrode and AC weld has spherical electrode. DC weld causes magnetised weld. In AC machine the electrode is not touched for starting the arc, unlike DC machine. The filler rod physical properties must be similar to the base metal. On light guage metals backing is used to protect the underside of the weld from atmospheric contamination. On heavier stock the copper backup bars draw the excess heat.</span><span style=\"color: black; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div><u1:p></u1:p><br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 13.5pt; margin: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div style=\"line-height: 13.5pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: #333333; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\">MIG stands for metallic inert gas. MIG set uses a continuous consumable wire electrode which is fed through the torch at preset controlled speeds. Less time is required to train an operator ( a couple of hours, to know the transfer type ). All the welder has to do is to pull the trigger and weld. As a rule weld failures are often due to the starting and stopping of welding\u2014since this includes slag, cold lapping and crater cracking. Spray transfer has constant spray of metal. In globular transfer the molten ball at the tip of electrode tends to grow 3 times the dia of wire before dropping down . In short cut transfer each drop touches the weld puddle before breaking away from the electrode wire. Electromagnetic force squeezes the drop from the wire. The short circuit is broken and the arc reignites. Shorting occurs 20 to 200 times per second. Shorting of arc pin points the effective heat. Intricate welds are thus possible. Argon, helium and Co2 gases are used for arc shielding austenitic stainless steel.</span><span style=\"color: black; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div><u1:p></u1:p><br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 13.5pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: #333333; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\">Generally surface porosity is the direct result of atmospheric contamination. The chief cause of crater defects is due to mindlessly removing the gun and shielding gas before the puddle has solidified.</span><span style=\"color: black; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div><u1:p></u1:p><br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 13.5pt; margin: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div style=\"line-height: 13.5pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: #333333; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\">Plasma arc cutting:</span><span style=\"color: black; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div><u1:p></u1:p><br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 13.5pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: #333333; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\">Temperatures up to a mind boggling 28000 deg C is possible. Plasma cutting is used in ship yards for high speed cutting of SS. Plasma is often considered the fourth state of matter. The other three being gas, liquid and solid. Plasma results when a gas is heated to a high temp and changes into positive ions , neutral atoms and negative electrons. When matter passes from one state to another latent heat is generated. Plasma torch supplies energy to a gas to change it to plasma. When plasma changes back to a gas heat is released. In a plasma arc torch the tip of the electrode is located within the nozzle which has a very small orifice. The gas emerges in the form of a supersonic jet hotter than any flame. It melts any known metal and its velocity blasts the molten metal through the kerf. When cutting SS best results are obtained with an Argon Hydrogen or Nitrogen Hydrogen gas mixture. Cooling water is used.</span><span style=\"color: black; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div><u1:p></u1:p><br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 13.5pt; margin: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div style=\"line-height: 13.5pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: #333333; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\">Plasma welding:</span><span style=\"color: black; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div><u1:p></u1:p><br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 13.5pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: #333333; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\">A central core of extreme temp surrounded by a sheath of cool gas. The required heat for fusion is generated by an electric arc which has been intensified by the injection of a gas into the arc stream. The superheated columnal arc is concentrated into a narrow stream. This when directed on metal makes possible penetrative welds without filler rods or edge preparation.so what is the big deal between tig and plasma welding? In plasma welding the arc column is constricted for higher heat. The arc plasma actually becomes a jet of high density current. The arc gas upon striking the metal cuts or keyholes entirely through the piece producing a small hole which is carried along the weld seam.during this cutting action the melted metal in front of the arc flows around the arc column then is immediately drawn together behind the hole by surface tension and reforms into a weld bead. A heavy duty DC rectifier is used as a source of power for plasma welding. Argon is used as plasma gas and helium as shielding gas ( argon too ).</span><span style=\"color: black; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div><u1:p></u1:p><br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 13.5pt; margin: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div style=\"line-height: 13.5pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: #333333; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\">Bottom line: fresh water rinsing of stainless steel tanks after tankcleaning with salt water must be doen by tankcleaning machine and not by hand hoses.</span><span style=\"color: black; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div><u1:p></u1:p><br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 13.5pt; margin: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div style=\"line-height: 13.5pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: #333333; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\">Some cargoes like Phosphoric acid and Sulphuric acid may form brown stains in the tanks and will not go with Nitric acid passivation or Metal brite. Such discolouration may be left as it is.</span><span style=\"color: black; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div><u1:p></u1:p><br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 13.5pt; margin: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div style=\"line-height: 13.5pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: #333333; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\">REMEMBER--Once the ship has been delivered , unless repairs have been done or contaminated with carbon steel or rusted by a very corrosive cargo--pickling is not necessary.</span><span style=\"color: black; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div><u1:p></u1:p><br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 13.5pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: #333333; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\">Know the temp of all chemicals to be loaded before accepting them on board.</span><span style=\"color: black; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div><u1:p></u1:p><br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 13.5pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: #333333; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\">Salt water at &gt;75deg c for &gt; 2hrs washing affects the SS. So after heated Palm oil Fatty acids, the SS layer gets affected.</span><span style=\"color: black; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div><u1:p></u1:p><br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 13.5pt; margin: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div style=\"line-height: 13.5pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: #333333; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\">When inspecting a SS tank use a magnifying glass, a good digital camera, a ladder and a good torch and chalk and a mirror. For cargoes requiring inert gas\u2014inspect the space above the cargo level.</span><span style=\"color: black; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div><u1:p></u1:p><br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 13.5pt; margin: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div style=\"line-height: 13.5pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: #333333; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\">Carriage of aggressive chemicals:--</span><span style=\"color: black; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div><u1:p></u1:p><br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 13.5pt; margin: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div style=\"line-height: 13.5pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: #333333; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\">Chlorinated HC must be stabilised so that no decomposition can occur. Temp must be less than 35C. the ppm of components must be less than</span><span style=\"color: black; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div><u1:p></u1:p><br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 13.5pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: #333333; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\">Water/ 100 ppm</span><span style=\"color: black; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div><u1:p></u1:p><br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 13.5pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: #333333; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\">Salt/ 15ppm</span><span style=\"color: black; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div><u1:p></u1:p><br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 13.5pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: #333333; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\">Hcl/ 15 ppm</span><span style=\"color: black; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div><u1:p></u1:p><br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 13.5pt; margin: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div style=\"line-height: 13.5pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: #333333; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\">For sodium hypochlorite solutions check the resistance tables for the carriage temp and the dilution strength. It cannot be carried on 316L and the clad steel will get holed during the voyage. 316LN, 317L and 317LN can handle the cargo</span><span style=\"color: black; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div><u1:p></u1:p><br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 13.5pt; margin: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div style=\"line-height: 13.5pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: #333333; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\">Allyl chloride at 20C pits 304L to 317L the same amount. 317LN is effected less.</span><span style=\"color: black; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div><u1:p></u1:p><br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 13.5pt; margin: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div style=\"line-height: 13.5pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: #333333; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\">Benzyl chloride and Benzene Sulphonyl Chloride at 20C pits 304L, 316L, 316LN, 317L, and 317LN almost the same.</span><span style=\"color: black; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div><u1:p></u1:p><br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 13.5pt; margin: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div style=\"line-height: 13.5pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: #333333; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\">Caustic potash must be carried less than 45 deg c and less than 50% dilution</span><span style=\"color: black; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div><u1:p></u1:p><br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 13.5pt; margin: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div style=\"line-height: 13.5pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: #333333; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\">Nitric acid of &gt;90 strength cannot be carried. Lesser strengths depend on carriage temp .</span><span style=\"color: black; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div><u1:p></u1:p><br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 13.5pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: #333333; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\">Eg\u2014</span><span style=\"color: black; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div><u1:p></u1:p><br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 13.5pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: #333333; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\">70% to 90% --max 50 deg c</span><span style=\"color: black; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div><u1:p></u1:p><br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 13.5pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: #333333; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\">&lt;70 %--max 70 deg c Sulfic acid\u2014 Must be &gt;96% and &lt;35 deg c</span><span style=\"color: black; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div><u1:p></u1:p><br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 13.5pt; margin: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div style=\"line-height: 13.5pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: #333333; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\">Sodium hydroxide solution, borohydride/ sodium hydroxide solution and potassium hydroxide solution must be less than 70% and 80 deg C</span><span style=\"color: black; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div><u1:p></u1:p><br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 13.5pt; margin: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div style=\"line-height: 13.5pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: #333333; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\">N-butyraldehyde, N-valeraldehyde and iso-valeraldehyde must be carried under inert gas padding.</span><span style=\"color: black; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div><u1:p></u1:p><br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 13.5pt; margin: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div style=\"line-height: 13.5pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: #333333; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\">The heavy oxides on the heat affected zone formed by a new weld repair can be removed by hydrofluoric acid pickling.</span><span style=\"color: black; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div><u1:p></u1:p><br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 13.5pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: #333333; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\">Nitric acid can both remove free iron and oxidize (passivate) the SS surface. It will not remove oxides.</span><span style=\"color: black; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div><u1:p></u1:p><br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 13.5pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: #333333; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\">Hydrogen peroxide can oxidize the SS surface but it cannot remove free iron to create the chromium rich layer that then oxidizes very readily in air to form the passive layer.</span><span style=\"color: black; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div><u1:p></u1:p><br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 13.5pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: #333333; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\">Citric acid passivation solutions can also get high chrome oxide ratios on the surface, and good resistance to corrosion .</span><span style=\"color: black; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div><u1:p></u1:p><br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 13.5pt; margin: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div style=\"line-height: 13.5pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: #333333; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\">AND FINALLY-- Any repairs to SS tanks are only to be carried out after authorisation from us.</span><span style=\"color: black; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\"><div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\"><a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/_tugjD0mUn6M/TQnq8Slc8MI/AAAAAAAACDU/o9FcJqAJK1g/s1600/P4040104+%25281%2529.JPG\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/_tugjD0mUn6M/TQnq8Slc8MI/AAAAAAAACDU/o9FcJqAJK1g/s1600/P4040104+%25281%2529.JPG\" /></a></div></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\"><span style=\"font-family: Arial, sans-serif;\"><o:p><br />\n</o:p></span></div><div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\"><a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/_tugjD0mUn6M/TQnq-9F5SPI/AAAAAAAACDY/caIug3mBZnM/s1600/P4040107.JPG\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/_tugjD0mUn6M/TQnq-9F5SPI/AAAAAAAACDY/caIug3mBZnM/s1600/P4040107.JPG\" /></a></div><span style=\"font-family: Arial, sans-serif;\"><o:p><div class=\"MsoNormal\"><br />\n</div></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: Arial, sans-serif;\"><o:p>CAPT AJIT VADAKAYIL ( 29 YEARS IN COMMAND )</o:p></span></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\"><span style=\"font-family: Arial, sans-serif;\"><o:p></o:p></span>&nbsp;</div><div class=\"MsoNormal\"><span style=\"font-family: Arial, sans-serif;\"><o:p>..</o:p></span></div></div></div>", "author": {"id": "14410812789424637654", "displayName": "Capt. Ajit Vadakayil", "url": "https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654", "image": {"url": "//4.bp.blogspot.com/-QSnd-Z8F7Kc/XFtPudWdwlI/AAAAAAABfq4/vxrkFOO7Iu8Mf6-OaPgw6FPpRDSmMgLdgCK4BGAYYCw/s35/capt%25252BajitC%25252Bvadakayil.JPG"}}, "replies": {"totalItems": "9", "selfLink": "https://www.googleapis.com/blogger/v3/blogs/3564735312144269387/posts/2852424997951322340/comments"}}, {"kind": "blogger#post", "id": "1539346510308199014", "blog": {"id": "3564735312144269387"}, "published": "2011-08-09T02:37:00+05:30", "updated": "2013-08-16T19:44:26+05:30", "etag": "\"iHf3yWDE_geBgZ8U7rgZ_xuTeAQ/dGltZXN0YW1wOiAxMzc2NjYyNDY2NzUyCm9mZnNldDogMTk4MDAwMDAK\"", "url": "http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2011/08/maradona-vs-pele-who-is-better-capt.html", "selfLink": "https://www.googleapis.com/blogger/v3/blogs/3564735312144269387/posts/1539346510308199014", "title": "MARADONA VERSUS PELE,  WHO IS BETTER? -  CAPT AJIT VADAKAYIL", "content": "<div dir=\"ltr\" style=\"text-align: left;\" trbidi=\"on\">\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\">PELE, EDSON ARANTES DO NASIMENTO-</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"color: red;\">THE <span style=\"color: blue;\">KING OF SOCCER</span>-&nbsp; FIFA'S LOVE CHILD- THE ROLE MODEL - THE BLACK PEARL- THE NATIONAL TREASURE OF BRAZIL -</span> <br />\n<br />\n<br />\nFirst watch these videos , and get that feeling.<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-9fadsKlPzrQ/TkA29SXMOrI/AAAAAAAAFNE/hEKMpOrVAaE/s1600/ABC.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"400\" src=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-9fadsKlPzrQ/TkA29SXMOrI/AAAAAAAAFNE/hEKMpOrVAaE/s400/ABC.jpg\" width=\"325\" /></a></div>\n<br />\nDid you notice the bewildered looks and body language&nbsp;of half the Belgian soccer worldcup team above?&nbsp; Well, no prizes!&nbsp; Check out who is eyeballin' and who is using his perepheral vision to toy around.<br />\n<br />\nThat says it all folks!<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<object class=\"BLOGGER-youtube-video\" classid=\"clsid:D27CDB6E-AE6D-11cf-96B8-444553540000\" codebase=\"http://download.macromedia.com/pub/shockwave/cabs/flash/swflash.cab#version=6,0,40,0\" data-thumbnail-src=\"http://0.gvt0.com/vi/y9NUqCJs9Jg/0.jpg\" height=\"266\" width=\"320\"><param name=\"movie\" value=\"http://www.youtube.com/v/y9NUqCJs9Jg&fs=1&source=uds\" /><param name=\"bgcolor\" value=\"#FFFFFF\" /><embed width=\"320\" height=\"266\"  src=\"http://www.youtube.com/v/y9NUqCJs9Jg&fs=1&source=uds\" type=\"application/x-shockwave-flash\"></embed></object></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<object class=\"BLOGGER-youtube-video\" classid=\"clsid:D27CDB6E-AE6D-11cf-96B8-444553540000\" codebase=\"http://download.macromedia.com/pub/shockwave/cabs/flash/swflash.cab#version=6,0,40,0\" data-thumbnail-src=\"http://0.gvt0.com/vi/Ah8xBnjtYWw/0.jpg\" height=\"266\" width=\"320\"><param name=\"movie\" value=\"http://www.youtube.com/v/Ah8xBnjtYWw&fs=1&source=uds\" /><param name=\"bgcolor\" value=\"#FFFFFF\" /><embed width=\"320\" height=\"266\"  src=\"http://www.youtube.com/v/Ah8xBnjtYWw&fs=1&source=uds\" type=\"application/x-shockwave-flash\"></embed></object></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<object class=\"BLOGGER-youtube-video\" classid=\"clsid:D27CDB6E-AE6D-11cf-96B8-444553540000\" codebase=\"http://download.macromedia.com/pub/shockwave/cabs/flash/swflash.cab#version=6,0,40,0\" data-thumbnail-src=\"http://3.gvt0.com/vi/i_PP7QJwNpM/0.jpg\" height=\"266\" width=\"320\"><param name=\"movie\" value=\"http://www.youtube.com/v/i_PP7QJwNpM&fs=1&source=uds\" /><param name=\"bgcolor\" value=\"#FFFFFF\" /><embed width=\"320\" height=\"266\"  src=\"http://www.youtube.com/v/i_PP7QJwNpM&fs=1&source=uds\" type=\"application/x-shockwave-flash\"></embed></object></div>\n<br />\n<br />\nIn one of the world cup games Pele who gave the opening FIFA speech was sitting like the cat who swallowed all ze cream , in the&nbsp;Queen's box with Platini and party&nbsp;, in the stadium.&nbsp; <br />\n<br />\nMaradona was NOT even invited, and on the way to the stadium the police confiscated his car.&nbsp; So my son taunted me \" Daddy, your hero is nowhere in the limelight!\"<br />\n<br />\nI replied \" Son, just wait. Let Maradona come into the stadium and sit in the cheap gallery stands. See the collective faces of Pele and FIFA at that time. When the God of soccer sits in the 20th row, that very spot becomes more important than the Queen's box. A donkey on a throne does NOT become king. That is the way the cookie crumbles \"<br />\n<br />\nSoon enough Maradona walks in, like the cool cat he is -- <br />\n<br />\n--the crowd, gives a tremendous appreciative roar, as the video cameras jostle to catch him climbing up the gallery stands. Every single camera and every pair of eyes -- except Pele's, &nbsp;were focused on him!&nbsp; Even the drunks woke up!!<br />\n<br />\nThe stadium crowd , and the common masses&nbsp;glued in front of large size TV screens&nbsp;set up on streets , soaked in this ultimate visual opium and chanted in unison \" DIEGO!&nbsp; DIEGO!!&nbsp; DIEGO!!!--\" <br />\n<br />\nI am sure Pele will be seeing this in his worst nightmares.<br />\n<br />\n--and imagine just a few weeks before Pele , had ridiculed Maradona of NOT being able to use his right foot. Why is it compulsory to use the right foot as per FIFA rules?&nbsp; Diegos' heavenly left foot did the job.<br />\n<br />\nYou don't have to be a genius to figure out why FIFA does not like Maradona who calls a spade a spade -- in any case nobody expects Maradona to represent FIFA and lump in all their hypocrisy--<br />\n<br />\nTo be objective in our analysis , we must pit both against each other when they were at the PEAK of their respective carreers.<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: left;\">\nFIFA and some people do NOT like Maradona because he is arrogant. Well-- a GOD deserves to be arrogant. In the jungle nobody likes to see a&nbsp;modest and humble lion.&nbsp; All love to see a proud roaring lion toying around with the lesser animals .</div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: left;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: left;\">\nWith true champions you gotta take the bad with the good, with a pinch of salt. That is why he is a champion --</div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: left;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: left;\">\nFIFA held a people's poll to judge who is the player of the century. Maradona got 53.6% votes. Pele got only 18.5% votes.&nbsp;&nbsp; Not to be daunted or undone FIFA gave his their own specially &nbsp;rigged up for such an occasion \" Football family award\" despite knowing deep down they are doing something terribly wrong. . </div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: left;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: left;\">\nPele's cup was plastic, Maradona's was full of heart and soul. </div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: left;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: left;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: left;\">\nSo after the FIFA ceremony on 11th Dec 2000 at Rome, Pele mocked in the&nbsp;press conference - \" If Maradona thinks he is the best player of this century, that it is his problem\" --and then he found to his chagrin that nobody was amused.</div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: left;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: left;\">\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\">FIFA politics is the disease of soccer.</span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: left;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: left;\">\nThe British loathe&nbsp;Maradona for that&nbsp;single \"hand of God\" moment -- which happened in the heat and thick of action at a goal mouth melee -- in the 1986 world cup ,( which eliminated England ). Well gentlemen, the little master&nbsp;plays with his whole body. </div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: left;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: left;\">\nAfter his peak , he could NOT handle the fame and took Cocaine. Cocaine does NOT increase soccer skills-- every idiot know this.&nbsp; Do we say, Queen could rock Wembley stadium just because&nbsp;Freddy Mercury took Cocaine?&nbsp;&nbsp;Yet, Cocaine is a performance enhancing drug for rock music.</div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: left;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-fgdIYg9dKjs/TkBXydS7aLI/AAAAAAAAFN4/ewyGZREBk5U/s1600/untitled.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-fgdIYg9dKjs/TkBXydS7aLI/AAAAAAAAFN4/ewyGZREBk5U/s1600/untitled.png\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: left;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: left;\">\nThe football was just an extension of his footballin' body. With people half a metre taller than him were jumping up and contesting for the ball, he did the next best.&nbsp; </div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: left;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: left;\">\nMaradona could dribble around the whole England team twice , tie them up in knots , squeeze the limey out of them, rather lick the mickey out of them, or which ever way they want it-- set up goals and <span style=\"color: red; font-size: large;\">handball it too</span> , in the blur of an eye-- before you could say Womanches --- nay-- Manchester..</div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: left;\">\n<br /></div>\n<object class=\"BLOGGER-youtube-video\" classid=\"clsid:D27CDB6E-AE6D-11cf-96B8-444553540000\" codebase=\"http://download.macromedia.com/pub/shockwave/cabs/flash/swflash.cab#version=6,0,40,0\" data-thumbnail-src=\"http://2.gvt0.com/vi/DbbsytHDp2o/0.jpg\" height=\"266\" width=\"320\"><param name=\"movie\" value=\"http://www.youtube.com/v/DbbsytHDp2o&fs=1&source=uds\" /><param name=\"bgcolor\" value=\"#FFFFFF\" /><embed width=\"320\" height=\"266\"  src=\"http://www.youtube.com/v/DbbsytHDp2o&fs=1&source=uds\" type=\"application/x-shockwave-flash\"></embed></object><br />\n<br />\nPele was a stalking striker, who scored goals created by equally or more talented players.<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: left;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: left;\">\nMaradona was a busy playmaking midfielder, who singlehandedly created goals for himself and others..</div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: left;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: left;\">\nPele scored more goals ( 1281 goals in 1363 games ) than Maradona , because he played within his comfort zone, &nbsp;in low skill local Brazilian and US leagues.&nbsp; </div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: left;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: left;\">\nMaradona played in Europe, OK?&nbsp; When did a Brazilian team or even a South American team last win any world club championship?&nbsp; </div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: left;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: left;\">\nThere is a joke doin' the rounds that even the goal scored by Pele in the Hollywood movie Victory ( 1981--starring Michael Cine / Sylvester Stallone&nbsp;) he acted , is counted in his super goal tally .&nbsp; The ones he scored when he was in the Brazilian army with zilch skill anywhere around, is of course counted hush hush..</div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: left;\">\n<br /></div>\nIn 1986, Argentina won the world cup. Every single TV station, newspaper and magazine predicted that Diego at his peak , would win it single handedly for the substandard team Argentina.&nbsp; He did it--and how!&nbsp; It was a piece of cake.&nbsp; Could Pele have ever done this?<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: left;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: left;\">\nAnd then Maradona goes and plays for barrel bottom scrapin'&nbsp; club Napoli. Every TV channel, newspaper and magazine predicted that Diego would do an encore. He did it yet again - and how!&nbsp; Could Pele have ever done this? </div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: left;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: left;\">\nI can rest my case here-- but let me finish--</div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: left;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-qaFq5_w9s3E/TkBXeWJIyCI/AAAAAAAAFNw/ACZ8WMdpt18/s1600/imagesCA0J5CKH.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-qaFq5_w9s3E/TkBXeWJIyCI/AAAAAAAAFNw/ACZ8WMdpt18/s1600/imagesCA0J5CKH.jpg\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: left;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: left;\">\nGods leave a legacy! This planet does hold the Maradona legacy. Pele is a mere mortal king . Maradona is the God of soccer.</div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: left;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-vWEJF8yjrhU/TkBXZVkF_RI/AAAAAAAAFNs/XIR03YcnN2M/s1600/imagesrt.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-vWEJF8yjrhU/TkBXZVkF_RI/AAAAAAAAFNs/XIR03YcnN2M/s1600/imagesrt.jpg\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: left;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: left;\">\nOK, Pele won 3 world cups 1958-62-70. . </div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: left;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: left;\">\nBut it must be remembered that Brazil could have done it easily without him too. In 1958 and 1962 Garrincha stole the thunder. </div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: left;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: left;\">\nIn 1958, Pele&nbsp;always came off the bench, unlike a Messi or Christiano Ronaldo of today , who are always starters. .&nbsp; </div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-npNIF27j-ic/TkBXTk0xfdI/AAAAAAAAFNo/riqcmWZGnyk/s1600/imagesCAZET716.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-npNIF27j-ic/TkBXTk0xfdI/AAAAAAAAFNo/riqcmWZGnyk/s1600/imagesCAZET716.jpg\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: left;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: left;\">\nIn 1962 Pele played only one game-- he was warming the bench right through the Wold Cup-- see how short and fickle human memory is. &nbsp;</div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: left;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: left;\">\nIn 1970 Pele got in because of his deadly statistical seniority.&nbsp; In 1968-69 he was NOT a regular in the national team, as others were fitter and better.</div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: left;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-sgzU8Z8t2TA/TkBXFC1Ek6I/AAAAAAAAFNg/GZvfrFHQc-k/s1600/rt.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-sgzU8Z8t2TA/TkBXFC1Ek6I/AAAAAAAAFNg/GZvfrFHQc-k/s1600/rt.jpg\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: left;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: left;\">\nIn the last world cup at South Africa with coach Maradona etching a lonely furrow on the grass walking up and down at the sidelines , with diamonds as big as cherries shining&nbsp;on his ears,&nbsp;the ball went to him and he kicked back in his classic style.&nbsp; There was an instant appreciative roar from the crowd -- the loudest in that edition of the World cup-&nbsp; they could now tell their grandchildren that they had seen the legend in action--LIVE.</div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: left;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: left;\">\nOne of the most vitriolic and&nbsp;\"no mincing words \" tongues in the world of modern soccer today is that of Jose Mourinho-- the Real Madrid coach..&nbsp; He remarked tersely \" You can like or dislike, Diego is the history of football!\"&nbsp; .</div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: left;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: left;\">\nBy the way the great Real Madrid player <span style=\"color: red;\">Hungarian Ferenc Pushkas</span> , is miles ahead of Pele. Hardly anybody today knows who Pushkas is-- even in this internet age.&nbsp; What a disgrace.</div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: left;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-IPAkKN1rgOk/TkBYdDmYzII/AAAAAAAAFN8/a0ufyp-E8Bo/s1600/imagesCAYIYB71.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-IPAkKN1rgOk/TkBYdDmYzII/AAAAAAAAFN8/a0ufyp-E8Bo/s1600/imagesCAYIYB71.jpg\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: left;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: left;\">\nMaradona represents the dream of every single young passionate soccer player in the world today--unless he is English-- who are unable to shed their snake skins or let go off old baggage.</div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: left;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-ODZOrD6L0jQ/TkBXsTLIDbI/AAAAAAAAFN0/73gAw_XSlq8/s1600/images.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-ODZOrD6L0jQ/TkBXsTLIDbI/AAAAAAAAFN0/73gAw_XSlq8/s1600/images.jpg\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: left;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: left;\">\nMost of the time striker&nbsp;Pele would just waiting for the ball to arrive at his legs&nbsp;so that he can score-- his goal gettin' style later copied by Ruud Van Nistleroy.&nbsp; In Kerala in Malayalam language we call it Kappikachavadam.&nbsp; </div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: left;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: left;\">\nMost referees would NOT call Pele offside, lest the&nbsp;FIFA monkeys straddle on their backs.&nbsp; Maradona rarely got favourable decisions.</div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: left;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: left;\">\nYou can just compare the kilometers Maradona and Pele ran in a single game-- on an average.</div>\nPele is bitter that Maradona has snatched away most of his die hard fans ( including yours truly ) -- he just retains most of the&nbsp;\"same skin colour\" party, &nbsp;who worship him as the black pearl.&nbsp; For these jokers it is NOT skill which matters, but colour of skin.<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: left;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: left;\">\nI am proud to live in the times of Maradona. </div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: left;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-osN7qbuvRbo/TkBW-w01SgI/AAAAAAAAFNc/BVzKcpO6PIA/s1600/bn.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-osN7qbuvRbo/TkBW-w01SgI/AAAAAAAAFNc/BVzKcpO6PIA/s1600/bn.png\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: left;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: left;\">\nThe flair, the passion, the explosive acceleration, the electrifying dribbling, the unsurpassed ball control, the unpredictable body swerves and feints, the team dynamics genius vision -- </div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: left;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-W03uhSSMEuE/TkBW08QdFtI/AAAAAAAAFNY/0rb8zFGg3PY/s1600/untitleder.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; text-align: left;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: left;\">\n---always in the thick of the narrow alley action -- all against taller and stronger opponents who were hell bent on savagely mowing him down.&nbsp; </div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: left;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: left;\">\nAs soon as he was felled down he would jump up and resume business without complaints -- Pele loved to make a wet rag scene and once even threatened to walk off.</div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: left;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-KegMwrSPukA/TkBWvLBb0BI/AAAAAAAAFNU/nl1j3GmYrlg/s1600/imagesCA6PMDSZ.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; text-align: left;\">\n<br /></div>\nThere can never be another Maradona-- he is the greatest of them all.&nbsp; <br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-4sQLDEWCbSg/TkBWpZyprdI/AAAAAAAAFNQ/I9FioTFY12M/s1600/imagesCAXKS88C.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">He shared his spoils with his mentor Socrates, and fellow homosexual side kick Aristotle ( 384 BC- 322 BC ) and got himself immortalized as the founder of the Academy in Athens, the first institution of higher learning in the Western world.&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;
